meanings.definition: The state of refusing to submit to authority or comply with established rules or regulations.
meanings.sent1: Her recusancy towards the school rules often landed her in detention.
meanings.sent2: The recusancy of the protesters led to a stand-off with the authorities.
meanings.sent3: His recusancy to follow the traffic laws made him a rebel without a cause.
meanings.sent4: The recusancy of the wild horse symbolized freedom and defiance.
meanings.sent5: The recusancy of the toddler to eat vegetables was a daily struggle for his parents.

meanings.definition: A person who refuses to attend services or take oaths, especially in the Roman Catholic Church.
meanings.sent1: The recusancy of the parishioner caused a stir in the church community.
meanings.sent2: During the inquisition, many faced consequences for their recusancy.
meanings.sent3: The recusancy of the cat to take a bath turned into a comical chase around the house.
meanings.sent4: Her recusancy to swear allegiance raised eyebrows among her peers.
meanings.sent5: The recusancy of the student to participate in the pledge of allegiance puzzled the teacher.
